column3: targeted professional development is offered to teachers and support staff on Fridays
column5: and at district trainings.\rThese planned learning sessions are based on the school's School Plan for Student Achievement goals and objectives.\r\rStaff participate in District professional development opportunities in the areas of Math
column6: Language Arts and the implementation of Common Core State\rStandards. In addition to our classroom teachers
column7: Heritage employs five part-time program support teachers to enhance the educational program. These\rteachers provide instruction in the areas of visual arts
column9: and physical education. While these teachers are providing instruction in these areas
column10: \rclassroom teachers are given the opportunity to collaborate and review instructional practices
column11: as well as receive professional development in identified\rareas of need.\r\r\rOur 2017-18 professional development is focused on 3 Reads Protocol and Guided Language Acquisition Development (GLAD).\r\rOur 2018-19 professional development focused on learning intentions
column14: and Sanford\rHarmony.\r\rOur 2019-2020 professional development focused on conditions of the problem
column15: high impact language development strategies and using accountable\rtalk across all grade levels and all curricula using a professional learning cycle.\r\rProfessional development (PD) delivery:  PD has been provided via a variety of methods including
column16: but not limited to:\r•on site staff meetings;\r•reciprocal teacher observation;\r•professional texts and readings;\r•professional development provided by the district;\r•resource teacher modeled and/or coached
column18: when she was promoted to a position at the district office; and
column19: \r•feedback and modeling provided by administration\r\rTeacher support during implementation:\r•Teachers are encouraged to implement these new instructional strategies and observed through the lens of safe practice.\r•Teachers receive instructional feedback via regular walkthroughs or regularly scheduled observations by administration
column20: and are encouraged\rnot only to consider next steps but to share their findings within their grade levels and system-wide.\r•Biweekly observation findings are shared during professional development meetings and in grade-level collaboration.\r•Quarterly student monitoring
column21: regular observations of student learning and teacher practice are discussed with each teacher where we share\rstrategies and next steps for instructional plans for growth for each child.\r•A compilation of student progress is shared regularly with staff for consideration of adjustments in their practice.\r•Quarterly instructional conferences are held with teachers to discuss instructional suggestions/strategies and techniques and open up to\rquestions or feedback they may seek.  ... column21: regular observations of student learning and teacher practice are discussed with each teacher where we share\rstrategies and next steps for instructional plans for growth for each child.\r•A compilation of student progress is shared regularly with staff for consideration of adjustments in their practice.\r•Quarterly instructional conferences are held with teachers to discuss instructional suggestions/strategies and techniques and open up to\rquestions or feedback they may seek.  ...
